provisions.title: Prohibition Against Violating Safeguards and Privacy Rules
provisions.summary: Respondent must not violate any provision of the GLB Act's Safeguards Rule (16 C.F.R. Part 314) or Privacy Rule (16 C.F.R. Part 313), directly or through any subsidiary, division, website, or other device.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Third-Party Security Assessment
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain biennial independent third-party assessments of its information security program, certifying that safeguards comply with the Safeguards Rule and adequately protect nonpublic personal information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Delivery
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, and supervisory employees within 30 days of service (current) or assumption of responsibilities (future).
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least 30 days prior to any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, merger, bankruptcy, or name/address change.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a written compliance report with the FTC within 180 days after service of the order, and at other times as required, detailing how it has complied; the initial report must include the first biennial Assessment.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: The order terminates on January 3, 2025, or 20 years from the most recent date the FTC files a complaint alleging a violation of the order in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy or Compliance Program Membership
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which it is a member of, adheres to, or participates in any privacy, security, or other compliance program sponsored by the government or any third party.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Program Membership or Participation
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent, in any manner, the extent to which it is a member of, certified by, endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy, security, or other compliance program sponsored by government or any third party.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Civil Penalty
provisions.summary: Defendant is ordered to pay a $35,000 civil penalty pursuant to Section 621(a) of the FCRA, with funds held in escrow by former counsel to be transferred to the Commission within 5 days of entry of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 628 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681w; and the Disposal Rule, 16 C.F.R. § 682.1 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained from misrepresenting the privacy or security of personal information and from violating Section 628 of the FCRA or the Disposal Rule by failing to properly dispose of consumer information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 628 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681w; and the Disposal Rule, 16 C.F.R. § 682.1 et seq.

provisions.title: Required Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Defendant must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive written information security program for any business he controls that collects, maintains, or stores personal information from consumers, including specific administrative, technical, and physical safeguards.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 628 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681w; and the Disposal Rule, 16 C.F.R. § 682.1 et seq.

provisions.title: Assessment Requirements
provisions.summary: Defendant must obtain initial and annual third-party assessments of his information security program for 10 years, with each assessment certifying the sufficiency of safeguards, prepared by a qualified professional and submitted to or retained for the FTC.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 628 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681w; and the Disposal Rule, 16 C.F.R. § 682.1 et seq.

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: Defendant must cooperate with FTC monitoring efforts, including submitting written reports, producing documents, appearing for deposition, and providing entry to business locations within 10 days of written notice; the Commission may also conduct undercover investigations and discovery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 628 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681w; and the Disposal Rule, 16 C.F.R. § 682.1 et seq.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting by Defendant
provisions.summary: For five years, Defendant must notify the FTC of changes in residence, employment, business structure, and name; file sworn compliance reports every 180 days and annually; and notify the FTC of any bankruptcy filing within 15 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 628 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681w; and the Disposal Rule, 16 C.F.R. § 682.1 et seq.

provisions.title: Record Keeping
provisions.summary: Defendant must create and retain specified records for eight years, including documents contradicting compliance, consumer complaints, law enforcement communications, and all compliance records; assessment-related materials must be retained for three years after each assessment.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 628 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681w; and the Disposal Rule, 16 C.F.R. § 682.1 et seq.

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order by Defendant
provisions.summary: Defendant must personally submit a sworn statement to the Commission acknowledging receipt of this Order within five business days of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 628 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681w; and the Disposal Rule, 16 C.F.R. § 682.1 et seq.

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 628 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681w; and the Disposal Rule, 16 C.F.R. § 682.1 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresenting Participation in Privacy or Compliance Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent, expressly or by implication, its membership in, adherence to, certification by, or participation in any government- or third-party-sponsored privacy, security, or compliance program.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy or Compliance Program Membership
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent in any manner its membership in, adherence to, or participation in any privacy, security, or other compliance program sponsored by the government or any third party.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy/Compliance Program Membership
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent, in any manner, the extent to which it is a member of, certified by, or participates in any privacy, security, or other compliance program sponsored by the government or any third party.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibited Misleading Representations
provisions.summary: Respondent and all persons acting in concert with it must not make any misrepresentation, express or implied, about any feature of covered software in connection with its advertising, promotion, sale, or distribution.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Affirmative Express Consent Provision
provisions.summary: No later than 120 days after service of the Order, Respondent must not preinstall any covered software unless affirmative express consent is obtained from the consumer, revocation instructions are provided, and a reasonable opt-out or removal mechanism is available.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Mandated Software Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive software security program — documented in writing — containing administrative, technical, and physical safeguards addressing software security risks and protecting the security and integrity of covered information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Software Security Assessments by a Third Party
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial third-party assessments of its software security program from a qualified independent professional, covering defined reporting periods, with specific content requirements and submission deadlines to the Commission.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of this Order within 10 days, and for 5 years must deliver a copy of the Order to all principals, officers, directors, and employees or agents with relevant managerial responsibilities, as well as to any successor business entities.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn annual compliance report one year after issuance, provide sworn notices within 14 days of changes in contact information or corporate structure, notify the Commission within 14 days of any bankruptcy filing, and route all submissions per specified instructions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create specified records for 20 years after Order issuance and retain each for at least 5 years (unless otherwise specified), including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, representations subject to the Order, assessment materials, and all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance by requiring additional reports and records within 10 days of a written request, communicating directly with Respondent, interviewing affiliated individuals (with counsel present), and using all other lawful means including undercover methods.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: This Order is effective upon publication on the FTC's website and will terminate on December 20, 2037, or 20 years from the most recent date a complaint alleging any violation of this Order is filed in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Mandated Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Each Covered Business must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive information security program protecting the security, confidentiality, and integrity of Personal Information, including specific technical, operational, and administrative safeguards.

provisions.title: Information Security Assessments by a Third Party
provisions.summary: Respondents must obtain initial and biennial third-party assessments of their Information Security Program from a qualified, independent assessor, covering specified reporting periods and meeting defined assessment standards.

provisions.title: Cooperation with Third Party Information Security Assessor
provisions.summary: Respondents must fully cooperate with the third-party Assessor by disclosing all material facts without misrepresentation and providing all relevant information and materials in their possession.

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Respondents must annually certify to the Commission, under the signature of a senior corporate manager or officer, that each Covered Business has established and maintained the Order's requirements, is not aware of uncorrected material noncompliance, and includes a description of any Covered Incident.

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports

provisions.summary: Within six months, Respondent must offer multi-factor authentication to consumer users and must not use MFA-collected information for any other purpose.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Notice to Individuals Affected by Identified Breaches
provisions.summary: Within 60 days, Respondent must email the prescribed breach notice (Attachment A) to each individual whose sensitive information was exposed in an Identified Breach and not yet notified.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Mandated Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Within 90 days, Respondent must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive information security program covering documentation, risk assessments, safeguards, employee training, access controls, MFA, encryption, vulnerability management, and service provider oversight.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Information Security Assessments By A Third Party
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial independent third-party assessments of its Information Security Program, submit the initial assessment to the FTC within 10 days of completion, and retain subsequent assessments for FTC review on request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Cooperation With Third-Party Information Security Assessor
provisions.summary: Respondent must fully cooperate with third-party Assessors by providing all relevant information, network and IT asset visibility, and disclosing all material facts without misrepresentation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Annual Certifications
provisions.summary: Beginning one year after Order issuance and annually thereafter, a senior corporate manager or officer must certify to the FTC that Respondent has established and maintained Order requirements and is unaware of uncorrected material noncompliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Within ten days of notifying any U.S. government entity of a Covered Incident, Respondent must submit a detailed report to the FTC including dates, descriptions, affected consumer counts, remediation actions, and copies of consumer notices.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgements
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit its own sworn acknowledgment of the Order within 10 days, deliver copies to relevant personnel, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file an initial sworn compliance report one year after issuance, provide sworn notices of material changes within 14 days for 12 years, and notify the FTC of any bankruptcy filing within 14 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain for 5 years (over a 12-year creation period) records including accounting data, personnel records, consumer complaints, all compliance documentation, and copies of privacy/security-related marketing materials.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC may monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting additional reports, conducting depositions and document inspections, communicating directly with Respondent, interviewing affiliated personnel, and using other lawful means including undercover methods.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates and Duration
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on ftc.gov and terminates 20 years from issuance or 20 years from the most recent federal court complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Corporate Respondent must not misrepresent how it collects, uses, discloses, or protects Covered Information, or misrepresent the extent of any Covered Incident or unauthorized disclosure.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Mandated Deletion and Data Minimization
provisions.summary: Corporate Respondent must delete all Covered Information not being used for customer services within 60 days, report the deletion to the Commission, and refrain from collecting or maintaining unnecessary Covered Information going forward.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Data Retention Limits
provisions.summary: Corporate Respondent must document, adhere to, and publicly post a retention schedule for Covered Information within 60 days, report it to the Commission, and update the schedule before collecting any new types of consumer information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Mandated Information Security Program for Covered Businesses
provisions.summary: Corporate Respondent and all Covered Businesses must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive information security program within 60 days, meeting detailed minimum requirements including written documentation, risk assessments, safeguards, training, access controls, monitoring, and vendor management.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Third Party Information Security Assessments for Covered Businesses
provisions.summary: Corporate Respondent must obtain initial and biennial independent third-party assessments of its Information Security Program, using a qualified assessor approved by the FTC, covering defined reporting periods for 20 years, with completed assessments submitted to the Commission.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Cooperation with Third-Party Information Security Assessor
provisions.summary: Respondents must fully cooperate with the third-party assessor by providing all relevant information, granting network and IT asset visibility, and disclosing all material facts without misrepresentation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Mandated Information Security Program for Certain Businesses of the Individual Respondent
provisions.summary: For 10 years after issuance, Individual Respondent must ensure that any Relevant Business for which he is a majority owner or senior officer with information security responsibility establishes and maintains a comprehensive information security program meeting detailed minimum requirements within 180 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Corporate Respondent must submit an annual certification to the Commission from its CEO (or designated senior officer) confirming compliance with the Order, absence of uncorrected material noncompliance, and describing all verified Covered Incidents during the certified period.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Within 10 days of notifying any U.S. government entity of a Covered Incident, each Covered Business must submit a detailed report to the Commission including the date, facts, types and number of consumers affected, remediation steps, and copies of consumer notices.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Each Respondent must acknowledge receipt of the Order within 10 days, deliver copies of the Order to all relevant principals, officers, and employees within 10 days (and to future personnel before they assume responsibilities), and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Each Respondent must submit an initial compliance report one year after issuance, provide timely notices of any material changes (within 14 days), and notify the Commission of any bankruptcy filings within 14 days, with all submissions made under penalty of perjury.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondents' compliance by requesting additional reports and records within 10 days, communicating directly with and interviewing affiliated persons, and using any other lawful means including undercover methods.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates and Duration
provisions.summary: This Order is effective upon publication on the FTC's website and terminates 20 years from its issuance date, or 20 years from the most recent date the Commission files a complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Prohibition against Misrepresentations about Privacy and Security
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent, expressly or by implication, its privacy and security measures, program memberships, user privacy choices, deletion/retention practices, or the extent to which it protects Personal Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Mandated Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive information security program within 60 days of order issuance, meeting a detailed set of minimum requirements covering documentation, risk assessment, safeguards, testing, and vendor management.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Independent Program Assessments by a Third Party
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial third-party assessments of its Information Security Program, using qualified independent assessors approved by the FTC, covering specified reporting periods and content requirements, and submit results to the Commission.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Cooperation with Third Party Information Security Assessor
provisions.summary: Respondent must fully cooperate with the third-party Assessor by providing all relevant information, network and IT asset visibility, and disclosing all material facts without misrepresentation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Respondent must annually provide the FTC with a sworn certification from a senior corporate manager or officer confirming compliance with the Order, disclosing any material noncompliance, and describing all Covered Incidents during the period.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a report to the FTC within 30 days of discovering a Covered Incident, including details about the incident's date, causes, affected information types, number of consumers affected, remediation steps, and copies of consumer notices.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Monetary Relief
provisions.summary: Respondent must pay $500,000 to the Commission within 8 days of the effective date of the Order via electronic fund transfer.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Respondent relinquishes all rights to transferred assets, the Complaint facts are deemed true in any subsequent enforcement litigation, paid funds may be used for consumer redress or related relief, and interest and penalties accrue on default.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Customer Information
provisions.summary: Respondent must provide sufficient customer information to enable the Commission to administer consumer redress to shopkeepers who did not receive payable commissions, and must respond to written information requests within 14 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn acknowledgment of the Order within 10 days, deliver copies to all key personnel and future personnel before they assume responsibilities, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit an annual compliance report sworn under penalty of perjury one year after issuance, and provide timely notices of changes in contact information, corporate structure, or bankruptcy filings; all submissions must follow specified format and delivery instructions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC has broad authority to monitor Respondent's compliance, including requesting additional reports within 10 days, directly communicating with and interviewing Respondent's personnel, and using undercover means without prior notice.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on ftc.gov and terminates 20 years from issuance or 20 years from the most recent federal court complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Billing Without Express, Informed Consent
provisions.summary: Respondent is prohibited from billing an Account Holder for any Charge without first obtaining Express, Informed Consent. If Respondent obtains consent for future charges, it must provide a simple mechanism to revoke that consent at any time.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Denying Account Access for Disputing Charges
provisions.summary: Respondent is permanently prohibited from denying, temporarily or permanently, a consumer's access to or use of their account — including any paid-for goods or services — for reasons that include the consumer's dispute of a Charge.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Monetary Relief
provisions.summary: Respondent must pay $245,000,000 to the Commission within 8 days of the effective date of this Order by electronic fund transfer.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Respondent relinquishes all rights to assets transferred under this Order; complaint facts are taken as true in subsequent litigation; money paid may be used for consumer redress; interest accrues on default; daily nonpayment constitutes a separate violation; and Respondent's Taxpayer ID may be used for collecting delinquent amounts.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Customer Information
provisions.summary: Respondent must provide sufficient customer information to enable the Commission to administer consumer redress, and must respond to any written Commission request for redress-related information within 14 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of the Order within 10 days, deliver copies to key personnel within 10 days, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn compliance report one year after issuance, provide sworn compliance notices within 14 days of certain structural or contact changes for 10 years, and notify the Commission within 14 days of any bankruptcy filing.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain specified records for 10 years (with 5-year retention), including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, research/testing records, law enforcement communications, custodial records, and all compliance-related records.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC may monitor Respondent's compliance by requiring additional reports and records within 10 days of written request, communicating directly with and interviewing Respondent's personnel, and using all other lawful means including undercover investigation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates and Duration
provisions.summary: This Order is effective upon publication on the FTC's website and terminates 20 years from the date of issuance, or 20 years from the most recent date a complaint alleging a violation of this Order is filed in federal court, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent in any manner the extent to which it collects, uses, maintains, discloses, or deletes Covered Information, or the extent to which Location Data is Deidentified.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibition on Collection and Retention of Covered Information from Advertising Auctions
provisions.summary: Respondent must not collect, purchase, acquire, or retain Covered Information accessed while participating in online advertising auctions for any purpose other than participating in those auctions.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibition on the Use, Sale, or Disclosure of Sensitive Location Data
provisions.summary: Respondent must not sell, license, share, disclose, transfer, or otherwise use in any products or services Sensitive Location Data associated with identified Sensitive Locations, with an exception for converting such data into non-Sensitive Location Data.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Sensitive Location Data Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish, implement, and maintain a Sensitive Location Data Program within 180 days, including developing a comprehensive list of Sensitive Locations and implementing policies to prevent prohibited use of Sensitive Location Data.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibition on the Sale, Licensing, or Disclosure of Private Residence Data
provisions.summary: Respondent must not sell, license, or disclose Location Data that may determine the identity or location of an individual's private residence.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Supplier Assessment Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must implement a Supplier Assessment Program within 90 days to ensure consumers have consented to the collection and use of Location Data obtained from suppliers.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Disclosures to Consumers
provisions.summary: Respondent must provide consumers with a clear and conspicuous means to request the identity of any entity to whom their Location Data has been sold, transferred, licensed, or disclosed in the past year.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Withholding and Withdrawing Consent
provisions.summary: Respondent must provide consumers with a simple, easily-located means to withdraw consent for Location Data collection, and must not unreasonably limit consumers' ability to withhold or withdraw consent.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Obligations When Consent is Withdrawn
provisions.summary: When a consumer withdraws consent, Respondent must delete all associated Location Data within 30 days and immediately cease further collection or use, subject to limited exceptions for security, archived data, and legal holds.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Location Data Deletion Requests
provisions.summary: Respondent must provide consumers with a clear and conspicuous means to request deletion of their Location Data and must create a process for Suppliers to notify Respondent of consumer deletion requests.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Data Retention Limits
provisions.summary: Respondent must document and publicly publish a retention schedule for Covered Information within 60 days, setting forth purposes, business needs, and defined deletion timeframes, and must update the schedule before collecting new types of Covered Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Deletion
provisions.summary: Respondent must delete all Historic Location Data, consumer phone numbers, and Data Products within specified timeframes, and must notify customers who received Historic Location Data of the deletion requirement.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Mandated Privacy Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish and maintain a comprehensive privacy program within 60 days covering risk assessment, safeguards, employee training, and ongoing evaluation for all Covered Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn acknowledgment of the Order within 10 days, deliver copies to all relevant personnel and any new business entities, and obtain signed acknowledgments within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn compliance report one year after issuance, ongoing compliance notices within 14 days of material changes for 10 years, and notice of any bankruptcy filing within 14 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission may monitor Respondent's compliance through written requests for information and records, direct communication with Respondent, interviews of Respondent's personnel, and all other lawful means including undercover investigations.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: This Order is effective upon publication on the FTC's website and will terminate 20 years from issuance or 20 years from the most recent date a complaint alleging a violation of this Order is filed in federal court, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Injunction Against COPPA Rule Violations
provisions.summary: Defendant and all persons acting in concert with it are enjoined from violating any provision of the COPPA Rule.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Civil Penalty — Payment of $10,000
provisions.summary: Defendant must pay a civil penalty of $10,000 to the United States pursuant to the FTC Act.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Distribution of Consent Decree and Compliance Guide to Current Personnel
provisions.summary: Within 30 days of entry, defendant must provide a copy of the Consent Decree and the FTC compliance guide to all current principals, officers, directors, managers, and relevant employees, and obtain signed acknowledgments; defendant must then submit a signed statement to the Commission within 10 days of completing this.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Distribution of Consent Decree and Compliance Guide to Future Personnel
provisions.summary: For five years, defendant must provide the Consent Decree and compliance guide to all future principals, officers, directors, managers, and relevant employees within 30 days of them assuming their positions, secure signed dated acknowledgments, and maintain copies for FTC inspection upon request.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting to Commission
provisions.summary: Within 60 days of entry, and at such other times as the FTC requires, defendant must file a detailed written compliance report with the Commission covering its Kids Club registration process, privacy notices, parental notices, consent methods, parental review mechanisms, necessity of data collected, and data security procedures.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping — Compliance Documentation
provisions.summary: For five years, defendant must maintain and make available to the FTC within 14 days of a written request all documents demonstrating compliance, including copies of information collection forms, web pages, screens, and representations about data practices, with specified retention limitations.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Notice of Business Changes Affecting Compliance
provisions.summary: For twenty years, defendant must notify the Commission at least 30 days before any business change that may affect compliance obligations, including mergers, dissolutions, name changes, bankruptcy filings, or changes in corporate structure.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Taxpayer Identification Number
provisions.summary: Defendant must furnish its taxpayer identifying number to the FTC pursuant to 31 U.S.C. § 7701 for use in collecting and reporting on any delinquent amounts.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Address for Reports, Submissions, and Notices
provisions.summary: All reports, submissions, and notices required by Paragraphs 14–19 must be sent by certified mail to the FTC's Western Region–San Francisco office.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Continuing Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter to enable any party to apply for further orders necessary for interpretation, modification, enforcement, or punishment of violations of the Consent Decree.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting to the FTC
provisions.summary: Within sixty days of entry, and at other times as required by the FTC, defendant must file a detailed written compliance report covering its website registration processes, privacy notices, parental consent methods, parental review procedures, necessity of data collected, and security procedures.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c), and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently prohibited from materially misrepresenting verification of privacy/security protection or the frequency of such verification in connection with advertising, marketing, or sale of any product or service.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Notice to Seal Purchasers
provisions.summary: Defendant must provide notice to each company that purchased or received certain ControlScan seals since January 1, 2007, informing them of the FTC settlement and requiring removal of discontinued seals.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment
provisions.summary: A suspended judgment of $750,000 is entered against Defendant (less amounts paid by Richard Stanton), which becomes due if Defendant misrepresented its financial condition. Funds may be used for consumer restitution or other equitable relief.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor compliance by requiring Defendant to submit reports, produce documents, appear for depositions, allow business inspections, and permit employee interviews. The FTC may also use undercover investigations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must notify the FTC of structural changes at least 30 days in advance and file compliance reports at 180 days and annually for 5 years, including acknowledgments of receipt and bankruptcy filings within 15 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendant must create and retain for 8 years specific records including accounting records, personnel records, customer files, complaints, marketing materials, and compliance documents.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Distribution of Order
provisions.summary: For 5 years, Defendant must deliver copies of the Order to all principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, and agents engaged in related conduct, and to any successor business entities, and obtain signed acknowledgments within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a truthful sworn statement acknowledging receipt of the Order within 5 business days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Notice of Entry of Order
provisions.summary: Entry of the Order in the court docket constitutes notice to Defendant, and Defendant waives all rights to contest proper service.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition on Data Collection Without Consent
provisions.summary: Respondent is prohibited from collecting information from Data Collection Agents unless specific disclosures are made and express affirmative consent is obtained from consumers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Consumer Notification and Support
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify Affected Consumers that Data Collection Agents were installed and transmitted information, and provide instructions and support for disabling/uninstalling the software.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Service of Order on Third Parties
provisions.summary: Respondent must serve Third Parties with a copy of this order before entering into or for existing contracts related to Data Collection Agents.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Data Security and Privacy
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which it collects, maintains, and protects the security, privacy, confidentiality, or integrity of consumer information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive information security program with administrative, technical, and physical safeguards to protect personal information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Third-Party Security Assessments
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial third-party security assessments from qualified professionals for twenty years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Deletion of Collected Information
provisions.summary: Respondent must delete or destroy Collected Information in its custody or control that was collected prior to February 1, 2010.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the Commission various records, including advertisements, materials relied upon, contradictory evidence, acknowledgments, notices, and assessment-related materials.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Order by Personnel
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to current and future principals, officers, directors, and managers with relevant responsibilities, and secure signed acknowledgments.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Notice of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the Commission of any change in the company that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, bankruptcy, or name/address changes.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file compliance reports with the Commission detailing how it has complied with the order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order will terminate on February 20, 2033, or twenty years from the most recent date that the United States or FTC files a complaint in federal court alleging violation of the order, whichever comes later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish and maintain a comprehensive information security program to protect personal information, with administrative, technical, and physical safeguards.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Biennial Security Assessments
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial assessments from a qualified third-party professional certifying the effectiveness of its security program for twenty years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC all materials related to assessments and compliance with the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Distribution
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver copies of the Order to current and future personnel with relevant responsibilities and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Change in Corporate Structure Notification
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least thirty days prior to any corporate changes that may affect compliance obligations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file initial and additional compliance reports with the FTC detailing compliance with the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: The Order will terminate on February 5, 2034, or twenty years from the most recent complaint filing, whichever is later, with specific provisions for complaints filed after initial term.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Security
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which it or its products maintain and protect security of Covered Device Functionality, security/privacy/confidentiality/integrity of Covered Information, or the extent to which consumers can control security of Covered Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Comprehensive Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish and maintain a comprehensive security program with administrative, technical, and physical safeguards to address security risks and protect Covered Device Functionality and Covered Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Third-Party Security Assessments
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial third-party security assessments from qualified professionals (CSSLP or CISSP) for 20 years, covering 180-day initial period and two-year periods thereafter.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Consumer Notification About Camera Security Flaw
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify Affected Consumers about a camera flaw that allowed unauthorized access to Live Feed Information and provide instructions to remove the flaw, using multiple notification methods for 2-3 years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to FTC various compliance-related documents, including Assessment materials for five years and other compliance documents for five years from preparation or dissemination.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Distribution
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of the Order to current and future subsidiaries, personnel, and service providers, and obtain signed acknowledgment of receipt within thirty days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Corporate Change Notification
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the Commission at least thirty days prior to any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, merger, creation of subsidiary, bankruptcy filing, or name/address change.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a detailed written compliance report with the Commission within sixty days after service of Order, and submit additional reports within ten days of Commission request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: The Order will terminate on January 16, 2034, or twenty years from the most recent date the United States or Commission files a complaint in federal court alleging violation of the Order, whichever comes later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy and Security
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which it uses, maintains, and protects the privacy, confidentiality, security, or integrity of covered information collected from or about consumers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibited Misleading Representations
provisions.summary: Defendants must not misrepresent the extent to which they collect, use, maintain, or protect the privacy, confidentiality, or security of Covered Information, or misrepresent the purpose of their collection, use, or disclosure of Covered Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b) and Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Settling Defendant and all persons acting with it are permanently enjoined from misrepresenting that they have detected security or performance issues on a consumer's Electronic Device, or any other material fact concerning technical support goods or services.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent in any manner its participation in privacy or security programs, the extent of any data incident, investigation results, data collection/use practices, or its overall protection of Personal Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Required Notice to Consumers About Respondent's Security Incident Response
provisions.summary: Within 14 days of the Order's effective date, Respondent must email all Affected Consumers an exact copy of the attached Exhibit A notice, with no additional information included.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Mandated Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Within 30 days of Order issuance, Respondent must establish and maintain a comprehensive Information Security Program with specific safeguards including documentation, risk assessment, encryption, employee training, network monitoring, and service provider oversight.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Information Security Assessments by a Third Party
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial third-party information security assessments covering compliance with the Information Security Program, conducted by a qualified independent assessor, with the initial assessment submitted to the FTC within 10 days of completion.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Cooperation with Third-Party Information Security Assessor
provisions.summary: Respondent must fully cooperate with the Assessor by providing all relevant information, network and IT asset visibility, and disclosing all material facts without misrepresentation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Each year after Order issuance, Respondent must provide the FTC with a sworn certification from a senior corporate manager or officer confirming compliance with the Order, disclosing any uncorrected noncompliance, and describing all Covered Incidents during the period.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Within 30 days of discovering a Covered Incident, Respondent must submit a detailed report to the FTC covering the incident's date, facts, types of information affected, number of consumers affected, remediation steps taken, and copies of consumer notices sent.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt to the FTC within 10 days, deliver copies of the Order to all principals, officers, employees, and agents within required timeframes, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a sworn compliance report one year after Order issuance, submit sworn notices within 14 days of any change in contact information or corporate structure, notify the FTC within 14 days of any bankruptcy filing, and ensure all sworn submissions are accurate and comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC may monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting additional reports and records, communicating directly with and interviewing Respondent's personnel, and using any other lawful investigative means including undercover contacts.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on the FTC website and terminates 20 years from issuance, or 20 years from the most recent date a complaint alleging a violation is filed in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Prohibited Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent, expressly or by implication, any aspect of its collection, use, security, or disclosure of Covered Information, or any security features of its Meeting Services.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Mandated Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive information security program within 60 days of the order, addressing risk assessment, safeguards, software security reviews, vulnerability management, data deletion, credential protections, security training, monitoring, incident response, and service provider oversight.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Independent Program Assessments by a Third Party
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial third-party assessments of its Information Security Program from a qualified, independent Assessor, covering specified reporting periods, with findings submitted to the FTC.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Cooperation with Third Party Assessor(s)
provisions.summary: Respondent must fully cooperate with the third-party Assessor by providing all relevant information, network/IT asset visibility, and disclosing all material facts without misrepresentation.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Respondent must annually provide the FTC with a certification from a senior corporate manager or officer confirming compliance with the Order and disclosure of any material noncompliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a detailed report to the FTC within 30 days of discovering a Covered Incident (but no later than 10 days after first notifying any government entity), including incident details, affected information types, consumer count, remediation steps, and copies of notices.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of this Order, deliver copies to all relevant personnel and new hires, and collect signed acknowledgments from each recipient.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn annual compliance report one year after issuance, provide timely notices of changes to contact information or corporate structure, and notify the FTC of any bankruptcy filings.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain for 5 years specified records including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, compliance documentation, representations about Covered Information, and Assessment materials.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting reports and records, conducting interviews, and using other lawful investigative means including undercover interactions.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: This Order is effective upon publication on the FTC website and terminates 20 years from issuance or 20 years from the most recent federal court complaint alleging a violation of the Order, whichever is later, with specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Mandated Privacy Program
provisions.summary: Each Covered Business must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive written Privacy Program that includes risk assessments, safeguards, employee training, service provider oversight, and annual evaluations.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a)(1), and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a)(1), 57b, and Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6502(c), 6505(d)

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Starting one year after the Compliance Date and each year thereafter for ten years, Defendant must submit annual certifications from the Principal Executive Officer and senior officers of each Covered Business confirming compliance with the Order and disclosing any known material noncompliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a)(1), and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a)(1), 57b, and Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6502(c), 6505(d)

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment for Civil Penalty
provisions.summary: Judgment of $275,000,000 is entered against Defendant as a civil penalty; Defendant must pay the full amount to the United States Treasury within seven days of Order entry.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a)(1), and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a)(1), 57b, and Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6502(c), 6505(d)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendant must acknowledge receipt of the Order, deliver copies to relevant personnel, and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt within specified timeframes.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a)(1), and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a)(1), 57b, and Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6502(c), 6505(d)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must file a compliance report one year after Order entry, submit notices of material changes within 14 days for ten years, and notify the Commission of any bankruptcy filing within 14 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a)(1), and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a)(1), 57b, and Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6502(c), 6505(d)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendant must create and retain specific records for designated periods, including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, and all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a)(1), and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a)(1), 57b, and Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6502(c), 6505(d)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission and Plaintiff are authorized to monitor Defendant's compliance through information requests, depositions, document production, direct communications, employee interviews, and other lawful means including undercover methods.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a)(1), and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a)(1), 57b, and Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6502(c), 6505(d)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a)(1), and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a)(1), 57b, and Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6502(c), 6505(d)

provisions.title: Prohibition on Disclosure of Health Information for Advertising Purposes
provisions.summary: Defendant and its officers, agents, employees, and attorneys are permanently restrained from disclosing Health Information to Third Parties for Advertising Purposes.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a)(1), and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a)(1), 57b, and the Health Breach Notification Rule, 16 C.F.R. § 318

provisions.title: Prohibition on Disclosures Without Affirmative Express Consent
provisions.summary: Defendant must not disclose Health Information or PHR Identifiable Health Information to Third Parties for Non-Advertising Purposes without first obtaining Affirmative Express Consent.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a)(1), and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a)(1), 57b, and the Health Breach Notification Rule, 16 C.F.R. § 318

provisions.title: Breach Notification and Notice Requirements
provisions.summary: Defendant must notify affected users, the FTC, and media outlets of any Covered Incident within specified timeframes and provide required notice content, and must delete noted information upon request.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a)(1), and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a)(1), 57b, and the Health Breach Notification Rule, 16 C.F.R. § 318

provisions.title: Privacy Program
provisions.summary: Defendant must establish and maintain a comprehensive privacy program that protects the privacy and confidentiality of Covered Information, including safeguards, controls, data retention limits, and service provider oversight.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a)(1), and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a)(1), 57b, and the Health Breach Notification Rule, 16 C.F.R. § 318

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: One year after entry of the Order and each year thereafter, a senior corporate manager must submit a certification to the FTC confirming compliance with the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a)(1), and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a)(1), 57b, and the Health Breach Notification Rule, 16 C.F.R. § 318

provisions.title: Civil Penalty
provisions.summary: Defendant must pay a civil penalty of $1,500,000 to the United States Treasury within 7 days of entry of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a)(1), and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a)(1), 57b, and the Health Breach Notification Rule, 16 C.F.R. § 318

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendant relinquishes all dominion and control over funds paid; the facts in the Complaint are taken as true and cannot be contested in any subsequent civil litigation by the FTC; and Defendant must provide its Taxpayer Identification Number.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a)(1), and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a)(1), 57b, and the Health Breach Notification Rule, 16 C.F.R. § 318

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: Defendant must deliver copies of the Order and obtain signed acknowledgments from its principals, officers, directors, and certain employees and service providers.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a)(1), and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a)(1), 57b, and the Health Breach Notification Rule, 16 C.F.R. § 318

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
