provisions.title: Employment Notification — Respondent Stiles
provisions.summary: Respondent Stiles must notify the FTC within the required period of any discontinuance of her current business or employment, or any new affiliation with a business providing financial products or services, for a period of ten years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title V, Subtitle A of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801-6809; and the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule (Privacy Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 313, issued pursuant to the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act

provisions.title: Corporate Change Notification
provisions.summary: Respondents must notify the FTC at least 30 days prior to any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations under this order, such as dissolution, merger, sale, bankruptcy filing, or change of name or address.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title V, Subtitle A of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801-6809; and the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule (Privacy Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 313, issued pursuant to the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondents must file a written compliance report with the FTC within 180 days after service of the order, and at such other times as the Commission may require.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title V, Subtitle A of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801-6809; and the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule (Privacy Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 313, issued pursuant to the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act

provisions.title: Order Duration
provisions.summary: The order terminates on December 10, 2028, or twenty years from the most recent date the FTC or U.S. files a federal court complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title V, Subtitle A of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801-6809; and the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule (Privacy Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 313, issued pursuant to the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy and Security
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which it maintains and protects privacy, security, or confidentiality of covered information, including claims about message deletion, screenshot detection, data collection categories, or security measures.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Comprehensive Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Hotels and Resorts must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive information security program for 20 years, designed to protect the security, confidentiality, and integrity of Cardholder Data, including specific administrative, technical, and physical safeguards.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), enforced through Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Cardholder Data Assessments
provisions.summary: Hotels and Resorts must annually obtain a written assessment of compliance with the Approved Standard, obtain additional certifications if noncompliant, and obtain a forensic investigator report following any large Breach, for up to 20 years after entry of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), enforced through Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgements
provisions.summary: Wyndham Worldwide Corporation, Wyndham Hotel Group LLC, and Hotels and Resorts must submit acknowledgements of receipt of this Order and deliver copies to subsidiaries, officers, employees, and other relevant personnel.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), enforced through Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Wyndham Worldwide Corporation, Wyndham Hotel Group LLC, and Hotels and Resorts must each submit an initial compliance report one year after entry and ongoing compliance notices within 14 days of any relevant structural or contact changes for 10 years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), enforced through Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Wyndham Worldwide Corporation, Wyndham Hotel Group LLC, and Hotels and Resorts must maintain all materials relied upon to prepare each Assessment for three years after preparation of that Assessment and make them available to the Commission upon request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), enforced through Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to seek civil discovery using Federal Rules of Civil Procedure to monitor compliance, and may use compulsory process under the FTC Act; this Part applies as long as Defendants have obligations under Parts I or II, plus three years thereafter.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), enforced through Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Wyndham Worldwide Corporation and Wyndham Hotel Group, LLC Parent Obligations
provisions.summary: Wyndham Worldwide Corporation and Wyndham Hotel Group LLC must ensure Hotels and Resorts complies with this Order for as long as they hold Hotels and Resorts as a subsidiary, but no longer than 20 years; their obligations cease immediately if Hotels and Resorts is no longer their subsidiary.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), enforced through Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains and has exclusive jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of modification and enforcement of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), enforced through Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy or Security Program Participation
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent, in any manner, whether it is a member of, adheres to, is certified by, or otherwise participates in any government or self-regulatory privacy or security program, including EU-U.S. Privacy Shield, Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield, and APEC Cross-Border Privacy Rules.

provisions.title: Duty to Protect Covered Information
provisions.summary: Respondent is permanently restrained and enjoined from disclosing, using, selling, or receiving any benefit from Covered Information or any information derived from Covered Information.

provisions.title: Access to Corporate Documents and Data
provisions.summary: Respondent must make all correspondence, financial data, documents, computer equipment, and electronically stored information available to the Commission for inventory and copying, must provide access credentials for any computer equipment or electronic data, and must notify the Commission before abandoning any corporate books or records.

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates and Duration
provisions.summary: The Order becomes final and effective 60 days after service and terminates on November 25, 2039, or 20 years from the most recent date the Commission files a complaint alleging a violation of the Order in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.

provisions.title: GLB Rule Violations
provisions.summary: Respondent and all persons acting in concert with it must not violate any provision of the Standards for Safeguarding Consumer Information Rule (16 C.F.R. Part 314).
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Mandated Data Security Program
provisions.summary: Each Covered Business must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive data security program protecting Covered Information, meeting numerous specific minimum requirements.
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Data Security Assessments by a Third Party
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial third-party assessments of each Covered Business's Data Security Program from a qualified, independent assessor, with specific reporting and submission requirements.
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Cooperation with Third Party Information Security Assessor
provisions.summary: Respondent must fully cooperate with the Assessor by disclosing all material facts without misrepresentation, and providing all relevant information and materials in its possession.
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Respondent must provide the Commission with annual certifications from a senior corporate manager or officer confirming compliance with the Order, awareness of no uncorrected material noncompliance, and a description of any Covered Incidents.
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a report to the Commission within ten days of first notifying any government entity of a Covered Incident, including specified details about the incident and remediation steps.
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must acknowledge receipt of the Order, deliver copies to relevant personnel and entities, and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit an initial compliance report one year after the Order, and timely notices of changes in contact information, organizational structure, or bankruptcy proceedings.
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create specified records for twenty years after the Order issuance date and retain each record for five years, unless otherwise specified.
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting reports and records, communicating directly with and interviewing Respondent's personnel, and using all other lawful means including undercover methods.
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on the FTC's website and terminates on December 22, 2041, or twenty years from the most recent date the Commission files a complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title I of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley (GLB) Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.; violations enforced through the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6805(a)(7)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondents must not misrepresent how they review data suppliers' consent frameworks, how they collect or handle Covered Information, or the extent to which their Location Data is deidentified.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibitions on the Use, Sale, or Disclosure of Sensitive Location Data
provisions.summary: Respondents must not sell, license, transfer, share, disclose, or use in any products or services Sensitive Location Data associated with identified Sensitive Locations, subject to limited exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Sensitive Location Data Program
provisions.summary: Respondents must establish and maintain a Sensitive Location Data Program within 90 days that develops a comprehensive list of Sensitive Locations and prevents the use, sale, or disclosure of Sensitive Location Data.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Other Location Data Obligations
provisions.summary: Respondents must establish policies and technical measures within 90 days to prevent association of Location Data with LGBTQ+ service locations, political demonstration locations, or use to identify individual home addresses, and must impose equivalent contractual restrictions on recipients.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Third-Party Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit a report to the FTC within 30 days of determining that a Third-Party Incident has occurred, including details about the incident's nature, scope, affected consumers, and remediation steps.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Supplier Assessment Program
provisions.summary: Respondents must implement a Supplier Assessment Program within 90 days to ensure consumers have consented to the collection and use of their precise location data, including documented assessments of all data suppliers and cessation of use of non-consented data.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Disclosures to Consumers
provisions.summary: Respondents must provide consumers with a clear and conspicuous means to request the identity of entities to whom their Location Data was sold or disclosed, or alternatively provide a mechanism for consumers to request deletion of their Location Data from all recipients' databases.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Withdrawing Consent
provisions.summary: Respondents must provide consumers with a simple, easily-located means to withdraw consent to Respondents' use or disclosure of their Location Data.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Obligations When Consent is Withdrawn
provisions.summary: Respondents must cease using and disclosing all Location Data associated with a specific device within 15 days after receiving notice that a consumer has withdrawn their consent.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Location Data Deletion Requests
provisions.summary: Respondents must implement a simple, clear means for consumers to request deletion of their Location Data and must complete such deletions within 30 days of receiving a request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Data Retention Limits
provisions.summary: Respondents must document, publish, and adhere to a publicly available retention schedule for Covered Information within 60 days, submit it to the Commission, and update the schedule before collecting new types of consumer information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Deletion
provisions.summary: Respondents must delete all Historic Location Data within 60 days and all Data Products within 90 days, notify customers who received Historic Location Data, and submit confirmations to the Commission, unless they can document valid consumer consent or deidentify the data.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Mandated Privacy Program
provisions.summary: Respondents must establish and maintain a comprehensive privacy program within 60 days that includes written documentation, board-level reporting, designated employee responsibility, annual risk assessments, safeguards implementation, employee training, and ongoing testing and adjustment.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit sworn acknowledgments of receipt of the Order to the FTC within 10 days, deliver copies to all principals, relevant employees, and agents within 10 days (and to new personnel before they assume responsibilities), and obtain signed acknowledgments within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit a sworn compliance report one year after issuance, notify the Commission within 14 days of changes to contact information or corporate structure, notify the Commission within 14 days of any bankruptcy filing, and submit all required filings electronically to the FTC.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondents must create and retain for 5 years specified records including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, law enforcement communications, representations about data practices, and records documenting compliance with key Order provisions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondents' compliance by requiring additional reports and records within 14 days of request, conducting direct communications and interviews with Respondents' personnel, and using all other lawful means including undercover investigations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on the FTC's website as a final order and terminates 20 years from issuance, or 20 years from the most recent date the Commission files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities — Identity Theft Prevention Program
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained from failing to establish and maintain a written Identity Theft Prevention Program designed to detect, prevent, and mitigate identity theft in connection with Covered Accounts under the Red Flags Rule.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Additional Prohibited Business Activities — Consumer Reports and Debt
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained from obtaining Consumer Reports without permissible purpose, selling or transferring debt on accounts where White Paging or Impermissible Co-Signing occurred, and furnishing information about such debt to CRAs.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Customer Service Task Force
provisions.summary: Within 30 days of entry of the Order, Defendant must establish and maintain for five years a Customer Service Task Force Program with specific procedures for verifying account identities, handling identity theft notices, investigating claims, and remedying illegitimate debts.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Employee Monitoring Program
provisions.summary: Beginning 30 days after entry of this Order, Defendant must establish, implement, and maintain an employee-monitoring program to prevent employees or agents from obtaining Consumer Reports without a permissible purpose, including documented safeguards, training, technical controls, an ethics hotline, disciplinary measures, and annual reviews.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Third Party Assessment
provisions.summary: Defendant must obtain initial and biennial third-party assessments of its compliance with Provisions I–IV from a qualified, independent Assessor, covering defined reporting periods, and submit assessments to the Commission.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Cooperation with Third-Party Assessor
provisions.summary: Defendant must fully cooperate with the Assessor by providing all relevant information and materials and not misrepresenting any material facts during any Assessment.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Oversight Requirement — Chief Compliance Officer
provisions.summary: Defendant must employ a Chief Compliance Officer who reports to the Board's Audit Committee and provides quarterly compliance reports to the Board on FCRA and identity theft risk management obligations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: For twenty years beginning one year after the Order's issuance, Defendant must annually provide the Commission with a sworn certification from its CEO or designated senior officer confirming compliance with Provisions I–IV and disclosure of any material noncompliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment for Civil Penalty
provisions.summary: A civil penalty judgment of $15,000,000 is entered against Defendant, which must be paid to the U.S. Treasury within seven days of entry of this Order by electronic fund transfer.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Consumer Fund
provisions.summary: A $5,000,000 equitable monetary relief judgment is entered against Defendant, to be paid within seven days to the U.S. Treasury and administered by the Commission for consumer redress.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendant relinquishes all rights to assets transferred under the Order, Complaint facts may be taken as true in future proceedings, and Defendant's Taxpayer Identification Number may be used for reporting delinquent amounts.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Customer Information
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained from failing to provide sufficient customer information requested by the Commission to administer consumer redress, and must respond to written requests within 14 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of the Order within seven days, deliver copies to principals, officers, relevant employees, and agents, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn compliance report one year after entry of the Order, provide sworn notices of material changes within 14 days for ten years, notify the Commission of any bankruptcy filing within 14 days, and follow prescribed submission formats and delivery methods.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendant must create certain records for ten years after entry of the Order and retain each record for five years, including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, employee training materials, and all compliance documentation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission and Plaintiff are authorized to monitor Defendant's compliance through written requests for reports and documents (within 14 days), depositions, direct communications with Defendant, employee interviews, and all other lawful means including undercover contacts.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition on Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent its privacy or cybersecurity protections for student information, or misrepresent the timeframe in which it will notify impacted individuals and school districts of a data breach.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Comprehensive Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish and implement a comprehensive written information security program that addresses the security, availability, confidentiality, and integrity of Covered Information, including strict access controls, multi-factor authentication, periodic access reviews, data inventory and classification, and periodic briefings to the Board.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Independent Third-Party Security Assessments
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain an initial independent third-party information security assessment and then biennial assessments throughout the 10-year order period.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Truthful Disclosure to Assessors
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent or conceal material facts from independent third-party assessors conducting security assessments required by the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Annual CISO Certifications
provisions.summary: Respondent's Chief Information Security Officer must submit annual written certifications to the FTC confirming that the information security program has been implemented and that there is no uncorrected material noncompliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Covered Incident Notification to FTC
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC whenever it notifies any U.S. federal, state, or local government entity of a data breach or unauthorized exposure of consumers' personal information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Distribution and Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: Respondent must distribute copies of the Order to officers, directors, and employees with relevant responsibilities and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file written compliance reports with the FTC within specified timeframes after the Order becomes final and upon request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain documents necessary to demonstrate compliance with the Order for a specified retention period.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: FTC Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC retains the right to access Respondent's facilities, records, and personnel to monitor compliance with the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Duration
provisions.summary: The Order terminates ten years from the date of its issuance, subject to extension if a compliance violation complaint is filed.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent and all persons acting with it must not misrepresent, expressly or by implication, their secure software development practices or the protection of consumers' financial assets.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Mandated Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive information security program designed to protect consumers' financial assets against loss from theft or unauthorized access, satisfying numerous specific sub-requirements.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Information Security Assessments by a Third Party
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial independent third-party assessments of its Information Security Program, following specific requirements for assessor qualifications, reporting periods, assessment content, and submission to the Commission.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Cooperation with Third Party Information Security Assessor
provisions.summary: Respondent must fully cooperate with the third-party Assessor by providing all relevant information, network and IT asset access, and disclosing all material facts without misrepresentation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Respondent's CEO must annually certify to the Commission that Respondent has established, implemented, and maintained the Order's requirements and is not aware of any uncorrected or undisclosed material noncompliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Return of Recovered Assets to Users
provisions.summary: Respondent must make available approximately $37.5 million in recovered assets to consumers via bounty, recovery bridge, or court-ordered process; provide website notice for 11 months; complete return of remaining assets within one year; and report on the refund program under penalty of perjury.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit its own acknowledgment of receipt of the Order, deliver copies to principals, officers, relevant employees and agents, and future personnel, and obtain signed acknowledgments within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a sworn compliance report one year after issuance, notify the Commission within 14 days of changes to contact points or organizational structure, and notify the Commission within 14 days of any bankruptcy filing.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain for 5 years specified records including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, representations about security practices, Assessment materials, law enforcement communications, and all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission may monitor Respondent's compliance by requiring additional reports or records within 10 days of written request, interviewing Respondent's personnel, and using all other lawful means including undercover methods.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is final and effective upon publication on the FTC's website and will terminate 10 years from issuance, or 10 years from the most recent date the Commission files a complaint alleging any violation of the Order in federal court, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act
